name: PubMed / NCBI E-utilities
description: Access 36M+ biomedical citations from PubMed, PMC, Gene, and other NCBI databases. Search abstracts, retrieve full metadata, and link across life science databases.

name: Semantic Scholar
description: AI-powered academic search engine with 200M+ papers. Provides paper search, citation graphs, author profiles, SPECTER2 embeddings, and paper recommendations.

name: OpenAlex
description: Fully open index of 240M+ scholarly works, authors, sources, institutions, and topics. CC0 licensed. Replaces Microsoft Academic Graph.

name: CrossRef
description: Metadata for 150M+ scholarly works via DOI. Covers journal articles, books, datasets, dissertations. No signup required. JSON output.

name: CORE
description: World's largest collection of open access research papers. Full-text access to papers from 10,000+ data providers worldwide.

name: Europe PMC
description: 33M+ life science publications including PubMed content, patents, and clinical guidelines. Full-text search with citation metadata and cross-references to UniProt, ENA.

name: Unpaywall
description: Database of 20M+ free scholarly articles. Given a DOI, returns open access PDF links from 50,000+ publishers and repositories.

name: ClinicalTrials.gov
description: REST API (v2.0) for accessing clinical trial study records from the NIH/NLM registry. Search trials by condition, intervention, location, and status.

name: WHO Global Health Observatory
description: 2,300+ health indicators for 245 countries/regions from the World Health Organization. Covers disease burden, mortality, health systems, and risk factors via OData protocol.

name: openFDA
description: Public FDA data on drugs, medical devices, and food. Includes adverse events, drug labels, recalls, and enforcement reports.

name: Open Science Framework
description: Repository and archive for study designs, research materials, data, manuscripts, and preprints. Supports open science workflows and reproducibility.

name: SHARE
description: Free, open dataset about research and scholarly activities. Aggregates metadata from repositories, journals, and funders to track the research lifecycle.

name: HuggingFace
description: Access 400K+ ML models, 100K+ datasets, and inference APIs. Covers NLP, computer vision, audio, and multimodal tasks. Free serverless inference tier available.

name: Papers With Code
description: Machine learning papers linked with code implementations, datasets, evaluation tables, and benchmarks. Community-driven, CC-BY-SA licensed.

name: Kaggle
description: Access and search 200K+ public datasets, notebooks, and competition data for ML research. Download datasets programmatically.

name: NLP Cloud
description: Production-ready NLP API using spaCy and transformers. Supports NER, sentiment analysis, classification, summarization, translation, and question answering.

name: Wolfram Alpha
description: Computational knowledge engine. Answers factual queries using curated data and algorithms across math, science, health, and statistics domains.

name: Wikidata
description: Collaboratively edited knowledge base with structured data on 100M+ items. Covers scientific entities, diseases, genes, researchers, and institutions.

name: Wikipedia
description: MediaWiki API for programmatic access to Wikipedia's encyclopedia content. Useful for extracting definitions, summaries, and structured knowledge on any research topic.

name: Nobel Prize
description: Open data about Nobel Prize laureates, their works, motivations, and affiliated institutions. Useful for research impact and history of science analysis.

name: NASA ADS
description: NASA Astrophysics Data System. Comprehensive digital library for physics, astrophysics, and geophysics research with citation tracking and full-text search.

name: Infermedica
description: NLP-based symptom checker and patient triage API for health diagnosis from text. Useful for ADHD/autism symptom research and clinical decision support.

name: Lexigram
description: Medical NLP that extracts mentions of clinical concepts from text and gives access to clinical ontology. Maps text to standardized medical terminology.
